intro: Acourtia rigida var. acuminata, commonly known as the rigid acourtia, is a flowering plant native to California and Baja California. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, elongated fruits. It is considered a rare and endemic species, often found in specific microhabitats within its native range.
